messages.title: EMPLOYERS WARN OF NEW JOB LOSSES
messages.content: Worries as rise in jobs tax looms. WIRRAL'S RECOVERY FROM THE RECESSION IS UNDER THREAT from a planned rise in the tax on jobs. The Government has, so far, refused to back down on the controversial move. 'There are 3,200 people out of work in Wallasey. This tax rise will make it more difficult for them to find work. The Conservatives will stop this rise in tax.' - Leah Fraser

messages.title: Last orders? 20 pubs a week closing as tax on beer goes up again - see p7
Labour’s negative tactics on cancer care slammed
messages.content: Many patients, including one woman who is terminally ill, received the postcard from the Labour Party warning that their care is at risk, depending on whom they vote for at the election.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposition to the planned rise in jobs tax, pledging to stop the tax rise.
Improvement of cancer care and making drugs that are currently paid for in the constituency available to cancer patients to make them available to any patient.

issues.economy: Concerns about the effects of the planned jobs tax rise on the local economy and employment.
issues.health: Criticism of Labour's approach to cancer care.

endorsements.endorsement: There are 3,200 people out of work in Wallasey. This tax rise will make it more difficult for them to find work. The Conservatives will stop this rise in tax.

quotes.text: 'There are 3,200 people out of work in Wallasey. This tax rise will make it more difficult for them to find work. The Conservatives will stop this rise in tax.' - Leah Fraser

images.caption: Leah Fraser pictured with concerned local resident.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Angela Eagle has been MP for 18 years. Time for change?
